item.title: 【Requests】[REQ VID] - Daddy Yankee Feat. Lloyd Banks & Young Buck - Rompe (2006)
item.description: Buenas Tardes, quisiera pedirles por favor este video, alguien que haya podido descargarlo cuando lo lanzaron. Muchas Gracias de antemano.
item.author: llJuanjoll

item.title: 【UPSCALED】Yello - Waba Duba [4K AI Upscale | HEVC 10-bit | PCM 24-bit 48 kHz | TrueHD with Dolby Atmos]
item.description:
Genre: Electronic, Pop
Style: Electro, Future Jazz
Year: 2020
Video Source: Apple Music, 1080p, thanks SonMaxime
Audio Source: Blu-ray, Point (Dolby Atmos Edition)

“Waba Duba” is a song by Swiss electronic duo Yello. It is the first track from their album “Point”, released in 2020. It’s the first new music from the (at the time of the release) 75-year-old Dieter Meier and 68-year-old Boris Blank since 2016's Toy album and forty years since the release of their debut album “Solid Pressure”, released in November 1980. Judging by the reactions the video has had on social media, not only has the duo's re-appearance come as something of a surprise, it's also come as a welcome shot of fun for many.
“Waba Duba” features Dieter's trademark booming vocals and Boris' inventive instrumentation coming from forty years of accumulating a library of over 100,000 different sounds and samples to work with and use at their disposal.

The band was originally formed by Boris Blank (keyboards, sampling, percussion, backing vocals) and Carlos Perón (tapes) in the late 1970s. Dieter Meier (vocals, lyrics), a millionaire industrialist and gambler, was brought in when the two founders realized that they needed a singer. The new band name, Yello, was chosen as a pun based on a statement made by Dieter Meier, "a yelled Hello". Founding member Carlos Perón left the band in 1983 to start a solo career.
Their sound is often characterised by unusual music samples and a heavy reliance on rhythm, with Meier as vocalist and lyricist, and Blank providing the music. They are probably best known for their singles "The Race" (1988) and "Oh Yeah" (1985), which has appeared in many films and television shows. The band has released 15 studio albums since 1980.

Release Info
If you own a Dolby Atmos set, this is a good demo. It makes great use of all channels, including the sub.
The video track is upscaled from 1080p to 4K with Topaz Video AI and encoded to HEVC 10-bit.
The audio tracks are lossless, ripped from "Point (Dolby Atmos Edition)", synced by muxing.
